column4: hey guys im having trouble installing spim in my ubuntu intrepid. My teacher said i could just do sudo apt-get install spim and it would work. But it is not working. I did research and its supposed to be in multiverse. I checked my sources.list and the multiverse repositories are uncommented. Any ideas on what i might be missing?
Have you manually edited the sources.list and uncommented those?
Hmmm...methinks that that would be a good thing.
hmm ok i go try it now
And bring me back a cheeseburger! :)
i uncommented the multiverse-restricted entries, and it still cannot find spim
Did you do an "apt-get update" -> ??
im currently looking at this. http://packages.ubuntu.com/dapper/electronics/spim if the package is available for dapper it should be available for intrepid
yes i did sudo aptitude update
Yes...SHOULD...
Matter of fact, if you already know where the .deb files are for SPIM, you should be able to just d/l them and install them manually if all else fails...
yes but it irks me , not being able to get this with apt-get
what am i doing wrong
let me cat my sources.list , and can you please take a look?
I'd tend to reckon that the person responsible for packaging it did not upgrade themselves...
You'll have to pastebin it mate.
http://rafb.net/p/vCpAUp76.html
Looks good - did you do the "apt-get update" or whatever, to reload the database?
yes, i did
I just checked the forums...
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=971047
It appears as though the package was removed on purpose, though you can still get the packages and manually install them...
thank you so much i appreciate you taking your time to help me
No a worry mate.
